headers.subject: Subject: Status Update | AI Executive Assistant Agent Workflow | 07/05/2025
headers.cc:
Cc: Kundan Ray <kundan.ray@oodles.io>, Mohit Virmani <mohit.virmani@oodles.io>, 
	Ravi Rose <ravi.rose@oodles.io>

html:
Hi, Team,

Here is an update of the tasks done today:

Tasks Completed:
  1. Go through requirements and set up a local dev environment.
  2. Trying to fetch sent email from a test gmail account.
  3. Tried using IMAP node but due to its limitations, switched to Gmail node.
  4. Able to retrieve the metadata along with actual messages from sent emails.
In-Progress/Next Tasks:
  1. Export the workflow from the local environment and import to the cloud one.
  2. Use received credentials to test the sent emails retrieval functionality on cloud.
Issues/Queries: None


Thanks and Regards,
Vikas Sanwal


Vikas SanwalAssociate Consultant L2 -Development

vikas.sanwal1

text:
Hi, Team,

Here is an update of the tasks done today:

*Tasks Completed:*

   1. Go through requirements and set up a local dev environment.
   2. Trying to fetch sent email from a test gmail account.
   3. Tried using IMAP node but due to its limitations, switched to Gmail
   node.
   4. Able to retrieve the metadata along with actual messages from sent
   emails.

*In-Progress/Next Tasks:*

   1. Export the workflow from the local environment and import to the
   cloud one.
   2. Use received credentials to test the sent emails retrieval
   functionality on cloud.

*Issues/Queries:* None


Thanks and Regards,
Vikas Sanwal

textAsHtml:
Hi, Team,

Here is an update of the tasks done today:

*Tasks Completed:*

1. Go through requirements and set up a local dev environment.
2. Trying to fetch sent email from a test gmail account.
3. Tried using IMAP node but due to its limitations, switched to Gmail
node.
4. Able to retrieve the metadata along with actual messages from sent
emails.

*In-Progress/Next Tasks:*

1. Export the workflow from the local environment and import to the
cloud one.
2. Use received credentials to test the sent emails retrieval
functionality on cloud.

*Issues/Queries:* None

Thanks and Regards,
Vikas Sanwal

html:
Hi, Team,

Here is an update of the tasks done today:

Tasks Completed:
  1. Setting up pyenv to easily switch between python versions.
  2. Setup OpenVoice v2 successfully.
  3. Define table fields for ADT^A01 (Admit Message).
  4. Took an initial call with Chris regarding the n8n project.

In-Progress/Next Tasks:
  1. Go through the requirements doc sent by Chris.

Issues/Queries: None



Thanks and Regards,
Vikas Sanwal

Vikas SanwalAssociate Consultant L2 -Development

Here is an update of the tasks done today:

*Tasks Completed:*

   1. Setting up pyenv to easily switch between python versions.
   2. Setup OpenVoice v2 successfully.
   3. Define table fields for ADT^A01 (Admit Message).
   4. Took an initial call with Chris regarding the n8n project.


*In-Progress/Next Tasks:*

   1. Go through the requirements doc sent by Chris.


*Issues/Queries: *None

Vikas Sanwal

html:
Hi, Team,

Here is an update of the tasks done today:

Tasks Completed:
  1. Creating a dummy project using spring boot to get familiar with the flow.
  2. Attend a standup call with Kundan sir and team.
  3. I Connected with molu tyagi and took KT for PathLink.
  4. R&D on HL7 v2 and v3 and find a third party Java library for HL7 conversion.

In-Progress/Next Tasks:
  1. R&D on HL7 v2 and v3 and find a third party Java library for HL7 conversion.

Issues/Queries: None



Thanks and Regards,
Vikas Sanwal
Vikas SanwalAssociate Consultant L2 -Development

html:
Hi, Team,

Here is an update of the tasks done today:

Tasks Completed:
  1. Download and install amazon corretto.
  2. Download and install intellij editor.
  3. Importing and running dummy project in intelliJ. The project was downloaded using "spring initializr".
  4. Demo project run successfully!
  5. Watching API creation tutorials using spring boot to get deeper understanding of the flow.

In-Progress/Next Tasks:
  1. Coordinate with Kundan Sir regarding actual project setup.

Issues/Queries: None



Thanks and Regards,
Vikas Sanwal

Vikas SanwalAssociate Consultant L2 -Development

Hi, Team,

Here is an update of the tasks done today:

1. Download and install amazon corretto.
2. Download and install intellij editor.

downloaded using "spring initializr".

understanding of the flow.
